exotic.name: Serendipitous Breeze
exotic.description: All journey activity results are improved to the next tier up.

exotic.name: Cruel Haze
exotic.description: During combat, all player characters have reduced passive regen equal to the round number.

exotic.name: Freaky Day
exotic.description: Each player rolls a d20. In descending order, each player gives their character sheet to the next.

exotic.name: Strange Music on the Wind
exotic.description: At the start of each player character's turn in combat, they swap spaces with another random creature in the combat.

exotic.name: Gaze of the Assassin
exotic.description: All hostile random encounters are empowered.

exotic.name: Gaze of the Gambler
exotic.description: Whenever a player character casts a spell or uses a maneuver, they trigger a Wild Magic Surge.

exotic.name: Gaze of the Legion
exotic.description: All hostile random encounters contain 1 additional foe and their rewards are empowered twice.

exotic.name: Gaze of the Manipulator
exotic.description: Each player sends the DM a message with the name of the a player in the current session, with no discussion. If any player's name is received multiple times, that player's character has disadvantage with all journey activities, and all other player characters have advantage.

exotic.name: Gaze of the Creator
exotic.description: Each player character's maximum HP is halved, but all damage they and their minions deal is doubled.

exotic.name: Mists of Slaughter
exotic.description: All hostile random encounters are pooled into one massive combat at the end of the day where all non-player creatures are hostile with all other creatures. All creatures start in random locations at the start of the combat.

exotic.name: Winds of Chaos
exotic.description: Instead of using their usual skill bonuses for journey activities, each player character instead rolls a d20 and uses that result. This is rolled after the player has chosen their activity.

exotic.name: Feywild Trickery
exotic.description: Players cannot choose their own journey activities. Instead, random ones are chosen for each player character and the check becomes a 50/50 chance of either critical failure or critical success. All player characters must attempt a journey activity.
